snippet: More than a dozen European foreign ministers want products made in Israeli settlements to be labeled differently from those made in Israel.
abstract: Israeli Foreign Min Avigdor Lieberman speaks out against letter in which 16 European foreign ministers ask for goods made in West Bank Israeli settlements to be labeled differently from those made in Israel, implying that request is anti-Semitic.

byline.contributor: Andrew Higgins contributed reporting from Brussels.

lead_paragraph: More than a dozen European foreign ministers want products made in Israeli settlements to be labeled differently from those made in Israel.

headline.main: Israeli Foreign Minister Denounces E.U. Proposal to Label Settlement Products
headline.print_headline: E.U. Proposal On Labeling of Products Angers Israel
